description: Triangle with subscripts (1,1),(2,1),(1,2),(3,1),(2,2),(1,3), etc. in which entry (i,j) is [ i/j ].
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..5050
formula: T(n,k) = sum_{i=1}^k A077049(n,i). G.f. sum_{k>0} x^k y^k/(1-x^k) / (1-x) = sum_{k>0} x^k y / (1 - x^k y) / (1-x) = sum_{k>0} x^k sum_{d|k} y^d / (1-x) = A(x,y)/(1-x) where A(x,y) is the g.f. of A077049. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Jan 28 2006T(n,k) = floor((n + 1 - k) / k). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 13 2012]
mathematica: t[n_, k_] := Quotient[n, k]; Table[t[n-k+1, k], {n, 1, 14}, {k, 1, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Nov 21 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a003988 n k = (n + 1 - k) `div` ka003988_row n = zipWith div [n,n-1..1] [1..n]a003988_tabl = map a003988_row [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 13 2012
crossrefs: Row sums are in A006218. Antidiagonal sums are in A002541.
author: _Marc LeBrun_
